item.title: Ongoing fly tipping from lower Clapton Road residents / businesses, 3rd February
item.description:
This littering / flytipping problem persists. Even the team charged with cleaning it up have complained. We know the source of the problem so why canâ€™t it be addressed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lower Clapton Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Various ongoing flytipping, 3rd February
item.description:
Flytipping around the back of the house by former nextdoor resident. He apparently lives in the garage behind the property. Landlord has reported problem numerous times to the Council and cleared the driveway before we moved in but rubbish is continuing to accumulate, including broken glass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Miah Close, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edington Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Cleaner left rubbish, 3rd February
item.description:
The week before last our street was swept and cleaned but they left two sizable bags of rubbish in grey sacks on the street outside my neighbours house. Who's responsibility is it to take away the swept leaves from our street? Would be great if this was removed, I tried to call with no answer and no way of leaving a message I had no option but to report it as fly tipping.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dumbreck Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge amount of rubbish, 3rd February
item.description:
Last night i witnessed 5 trucks in that area, today i woke up and saw all of this rubbish dumped there. Its a huge eyesore and im concerned for what may be in the piles. Also theres a man doing something there right now and its very loud

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 719, Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: Twisted road sign, 3rd February
item.description:
A sign which gives advance warning of a traffic restriction on Royal Hill has been twisted through 90 degrees so that it is not legible to motorists coming down Point Hill. Motorists who do not know the traffic management scheme could pick up a fine if they turn into Royal Hill. Those who are aware of the scheme believe that a damaged sign gives them the opportunity to challenge a fine.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Royal Hill, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 5 large potholes on Highview Rd (front of no.8b, 3rd February
item.description:
5 large potholes more than 1 foot wide (>10cm deep)have been on Highview road for over a year. Rocks are flung to either side of the road when cars drive over them causing risk to pedestrians and property. It also poses danger to cyclists and road users as they swerve to avoid potholes. Previous repair did not work.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8b, Highview Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in the river cray, 3rd February
item.description:
There is a shopping trolly , a scooter and two metal fence panels that have been dumped into the river near riverside gardens play area in the river. They have been here from some time. I have litter picked here but can't get these out they are too heavy. So annoying I know hoping you can get someone down there to clear them out. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
